intro: Eriospermum orthophyllum, commonly known as the silverleaf eriosperm, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves that are covered in a fine, silvery coating of fine hairs. It produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in summer, and it is adapted to arid environments. Eriospermum orthophyllum is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is well-suited for cultivation in dry, sunny conditions.
